meanings.definition: To stone or pelt with stones.
meanings.sent1: The angry mob lapidated the thief with rocks.
meanings.sent2: The villagers lapidated the windows of the abandoned house to keep out intruders.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully lapidated each other with pebbles during recess.
meanings.sent4: The hailstorm seemed to lapidate the fragile flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The ancient punishment of lapidating criminals was harsh and brutal.

meanings.sent1: In some cultures, they still lapidate people as a form of punishment.
meanings.sent2: The historical records show that they used to lapidate those accused of witchcraft.

meanings.sent4: The intense heat seemed to lapidate any hope of survival in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The cruel ruler ordered to lapidate anyone who dared to speak against him.
